page.title: 19A Local Character
page.content: A local character has recently died. His obituary in a local newspaper described him as farmer, litigant, historian, book collector, scourge of freemasonry, politicians, peers, leftists, rightists and policeman and as seeing evil and conspiracy everywhere. His main achievements were his exposure of the incompetence of Borough Council officials who allowed priceless library books to be stolen or sold when they were clearing out the old Bedford library and the dispute with the County Council over land at Village Farm where he lived. He appeared in person at the High Court and won the case.
